docs.lead_paragraph: Following are excerpts from the final day of debate on the articles of impeachment against President Clinton, as recorded by the Federal News Service, a private transcription agency:

headline.main: Excerpts From the House's Final Debate on Impeaching President Clinton

docs.abstract: Excerpts from statements by House members on final day of debate on articles of impeachment against Pres Clinton; include statements by Reprs Barbara Lee, Lindsey O Graham, Jose E Serrano, Christopher Shays, J C Watts Jr, John Conyers Jr, Tom DeLay, Christopher Cox, Dick Armey, Chet Edwards, David E Bonior, John Lewis, Henry H Hyde, Rick Boucher, Richard Gephardt; photos (L)
docs.snippet: Following are excerpts from the final day of debate on the articles of impeachment against President Clinton, as recorded by the Federal News Service, a private transcription agency:

docs.lead_paragraph: Many women know that taking 400 micrograms of folic acid, a B vitamin, early in pregnancy can reduce the risk of their babies' having certain birth defects of the brain and spine. But a new survey conducted by the March of Dimes warns that most women take it too late in pregnancy to be effective. Because nearly half of pregnancies in the United States are unplanned, doctors suggest that women of childbearing age should take a multivitamin with folic acid whether they are pregnant or not.

headline.main: Taking Folic Acid in Time to Help Baby

docs.abstract: New survey conducted by March of Dimes finds that most women take folic acid, a B vitamin, too late in pregnancy to help reduce risk of their babies having certain birth defects of the brain and spine (S)
